QuestData.Title: Trial by Superstition
QuestData.Description:
Witchcraft has long lived in the superstitions of the people here. It is only recently that some of these superstitions have become reality.
According to tradition, one who is tried for witchcraft is allowed to choose the means by which they are tested from among the requests of her peers.
The villagers here no doubt have some strange beliefs of what witches can and cannot do. Speak with them, and see what we can do to prove my innocence.
QuestData.LogDescription: Question $1oa Fletcher's Hollow Villagers in Hangman's Point.
QuestData.CompletionText: What have you learned from the villagers?
QuestData.RewardText:
Well, those are certainly some interesting beliefs. I think it's safe to rule out the fire and drowning, don't you think?
Looks like that leaves us with three tests...
